Posts.Content: Oh my, you poor thing. I agree call PALS and get the ball rolling. Make a nuciance of yourself until you get answers. It is hard enough to start to deal with the idea of this damn disease without extra waiting. I will keep you in mind and please keep us updated. Friend me and message me if you need to offload X
Posts.Title: What are you supposed to do? :(

Posts.Content: Hi there. saw Onc today, says likely the injections, need to take more pain killers. Due to start Tax next week, he says shouldn't be so sick but pain may be worse, great!!!!
Posts.Title: FEC and back pain

Posts.Content: has anyone else been having back pain. I have a bad back but this is terrible, low ache that makes me want to lie down. i know I had a very upset tummy which meant I was bloated and felt like belly pulling in back but this even hurts in bed, pas I say mid to low back, maybe even pelvis. Was injecting to keep bloods ok and thought it was that but no injections now and feels just as bad.
Posts.Title: FEC and back pain

Posts.Content: Thanks guys
Posts.Title: FEC and back pain

Posts.Content: Hi there, well you are ahead of me in the chemo and I am ahead of you in the operation but still have to have mastectomy as found multi focal DCIS. Gonna go for double MX in case. however, on the positive side they have found it early and treated it it has shrunk you need lumpectomy only they will find a vein somewhere don't worry I assume it was a stage 0 or 1 which has a survival rate of 100% !!!!!!! so stop panicking, start being positive and get ready to get on with life, it is too short as we all know so make the best of whatever you have. Much love, positivity and power J
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: hi I had last T 21 days ago.for the last week I have had numbness in my3rd and 4 th toes, they haven't felt normal at all and feel cold inside. is this peripheral neuropathy? Will it go away? Should I see my GP? any response welcome J
Posts.Title: Numb toes

Posts.Content: OMG Angie!!! my fingers are also weird and the way you described is exactly as I did, like overplaying the guitar. It is hard to do buttons, pick stuff up etc. Not due to see Onc until mid Fec but will mention when I see him, nothing they can do. I do however have a new guitar as a pressie for getting through chemo from hubby, so will play and hope the numbness of finger tips helps :) all the best J
Posts.Title: Numb toes

Posts.Content: Why not go for a crazy pound land wig? at least you can laugh at the state of it at a later date. seriously though, look at the old picture and see how silly you look, if you don't then I am jealous!! Borrow a wig, go into wig shop try in and ask if can have photo so can make a decision in own time, that way you don't have to spend needless money. Where are  you I am in North London and have a short blond is one you can use, don't wear it as it itches!!! good luck with the decision
Posts.Title: here's a weird question

Posts.Content: Yep, absolutely mad. I look in the mirror see a round faced, pasty, stubby haired ugh and am also sick of the pain everywhere, that with the white tongue and joy of eating and drinking cardboard every meal I have had it too. and also put o. 2 stones so well miffed. yes we are alive but bugger it is hard to rejoice!!!! much love J
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Hi Hawkster,  Ok don't panic completely, have a freak out then grab hold again. Having a diagnosis is probably the worst thing ever and like you I was soooo scared and fearful I would die. However there are many types, grades and treatments for breast cancer. Extra tests are vital to make sure you get the right one. The next week will be hell, go with the flow and cry, scream and rant here if you need too. It is hard to let go when family are also so scared for you and their journey is as difficult as yours. So, take each day as it comes, do some fun stuff as once on the treadmill it seems to take over life going from diagnosis, appointments, investigations and treatments in a whirl of fear,anxiety and shock. BUT YOU CAN DO THIS. WE ALL CAN BECAUSE WE HAVE TO! please know you are not alone, stay positive that so much is out there to help and as soon as you are given a Macmillan or oncology nurse ( scary words in themselves) use them to access support of others near by in the same boat or coming out the other side. hang on in there, stay positive and love yourself. much love and strength Jackie
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Well done you. thank you so much for posting, it feels like it will never end but you have given me hope enjoy life J
Posts.Title: 4 years on

Posts.Content: Fantastic well done you. sometimes it feels like there is no end, enjoy life, you deserve the best for getting through love J
Posts.Title: 4 years on

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine, did you have radiotherapy? otherwise possibly scar tissue. You don't say when you had the operation but scar tissue is the most obvious. good luck with check up and let us know J
Posts.Title: thickening of skin on breast, bc side.

Posts.Content: I agree in many ways, however she did put BC on the radar, just as usual by TV sensationalised it. she is due to have chemo and rads so would be interesting to see how she is doing now. I have FB messaged her, never know may get a reply and if I do will share with you guys. keep fighting the beast Love J  Ps she did reply, I would suggest you Facebook message her with your views, I am sure she never meant for anyone to feel belittled. She is on a huge learning curve and as we all have will learn at her own pace.  We say be kind to yourself but you know what, we need to be kind to others as well. For those who quote Victoria Derbyshire and have not trodden the road, well just suggest they get real and imagine how they would think, feel and react. Stay positive ladies Love J
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: Hi all Victoria has a new post on the BBC website re first chemo.  Realistic, heartfelt and true to form. Please check it out, you may change your minds re her motives J
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: OMG Having had the double mastectomy and reconstruction the swelling is going down, I had a huge hem atoms on the mid chest side of my right breast which has now gone down but can feel a hard lump about the size of a cherry in my breast. I am flipping out!!!!! It doesn't hurt like the hepatoma does.  OMG I am soon scared!
Posts.Title: Panicking another lump

Posts.Content: Sorry should have read haemotoma
Posts.Title: Panicking another lump

Posts.Content: Thanks guys, seeing consultant Thurs sonwilltry to chill until then :)
Posts.Title: Does anyone else feel a new lump after breast lump removal?

Posts.Content: is it just me. I am exhausted and still can't sleep. Not thinking or worrying just on overdrive. is it the FE. Or steroids. Took them lunchtime so hoped it would be ok but still wide awake, very unusual for me am usually asleep by 10!!!
Posts.Title: FEC and sleep

Posts.Content: Had op 3 weeks ago, not yet had results but can feel a lump in breast that wasn't there before.PANICING!!!!
Posts.Title: Does anyone else feel a new lump after breast lump removal?

Posts.Content: Hi Jojo second time O have tried to reply!!! Stupid site threw me off!! I am so sorry you are having such a crap time, you have always been so supportive to others and yet are going through hell yourself!! this damn disease certainly takes its toll and especially so for you. you need to moan and rant away, if that gets you through this crummy phase then feel free. you will get through and beat this, believe you can and we will all send positive healing vibes to you. take what you can for pain and if it isn't working ask for stronger meds, anything to get some rest as you will heal better if you can rest, as well as feel better emotionally. take care and much healing love coming your way J xxx
Posts.Title: Feels Neverending....

Posts.Content: Ha ha dream thief soo true
Posts.Title: FEC and sleep

Posts.Content: Just had first FEC. Ok but need a Pic line.  When am I likely to start to feel rubbish please?
Posts.Title: How soon will I feel crappy?

Posts.Content: Thanks, have stinking headache but think it may just be from the anxiety and heat!!!
Posts.Title: How soon will I feel crappy?

Posts.Content: Don't panic. i too had WLE and adjunctive chemo. I get stabbing pains in affected breast. Spoke to BCn who says it will still be healing and any healing cells will be attacked by the chemo hence the pain. So be assured that the chemo is doing its job but taking the cells trying to heal as well as any stray nasties. J
Posts.Title: Breast pains during chemo

Posts.Content: Hi all, I know those having radiotherapy often use aloe Vera gel but wanted to share this.  Following recent skin graft on breast flap they gave me aqueous cream for the donor site, I found it made it lumpy and almost more dry so have switched to aloe Vera and it is fab!!! Not only soothes but when it dries it kind of forms a film which doesn't get stuck to trousers. So girls, slap it onto sore bits, scars or just all over for smooth relieved skin. Keep going and be kind to yourself. Much love  Xxx
Posts.Title: Aloe Vera gel

Posts.Content: Just to update, we took him this morning and he went off to sleep quietly in my arms whilst stroking his ears. Such a loss, I am heartbroken. Thank you all for your kindness. Keep up the fight and be kind to yourself. Much love Xxx
Posts.Title: What is it with cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi, Do get your B12 checked. Since having B12 issues I can't eat eggs as they taste metallic. It is the white that does it. Maybe just try the yolk? Once I have had B12 injection it is easier but not perfect. This problem got much worse during and since chemo. Good luck
Posts.Title: Can't eat eggs after chemo.

Posts.Content: Oh my love,  I am soooo sorry this has happened to you!!! it is unforgivable that they treated you the way they did. please put in a complaint to PALS. What hospital were you at? As for the op, I am sorry I can't help. I am due bilateral mastectomy and DIEP flap fairly soon, just waiting a date probably mid January. I am sure your boobs will look better, remember they have pulled you about and so there will be swelling that takes time to settle.  As for the feeling of being butchered I am not surprised. it is traumatic enough without the added trauma of your theatre experience!! It is early days. it is normal for you to feel tearful and low after any operation as the anaesthetic takes time to get out of the system.  Recovery wise I would not count on 4 weeks, I have been told 8 weeks and that seems much more realistic to me. so, don't despair, I am sure you will feel better. Yes do your exercises but don't push it too hard. Your body has been through MAJOR TRAUMA as well as the psychological trauma of having cancer, needing a mastectomy and a traumatic surgical situation. Please be kind to yourself, keep talking to us and give yourself time to heal physically and mentally. much love to you J
Posts.Title: Anyone had bilateral masectomy with immediate LD flap reconstruction...

Posts.Content: Oh my love,  I am soooo sorry this has happened to you!!! it is unforgivable that they treated you the way they did. please put in a complaint to PALS. What hospital were you at? As for the op, I am sorry I can't help. I am due bilateral mastectomy and DIEP flap fairly soon, just waiting a date probably mid January. I am sure your boobs will look better, remember they have pulled you about and so there will be swelling that takes time to settle.  As for the feeling of being butchered I am not surprised. it is traumatic enough without the added trauma of your theatre experience!! It is early days. it is normal for you to feel tearful and low after any operation as the anaesthetic takes time to get out of the system.  Recovery wise I would not count on 4 weeks, I have been told 8 weeks and that seems much more realistic to me. so, don't despair, I am sure you will feel better. Yes do your exercises but don't push it too hard. Your body has been through MAJOR TRAUMA as well as the psychological trauma of having cancer, needing a mastectomy and a traumatic surgical situation. Please be kind to yourself, keep talking to us and give yourself time to heal physically and mentally. much love to you J
Posts.Title: Anyone had bilateral masectomy with immediate LD flap reconstruction...

Posts.Content: Hi Your ESR can be raised for a number of reasons including a cold, arthritis, swollen ankle etc so don't stress too much. It is not the overarching result needed to send you into panic mode. By the way I finished BC treatment chemo in Mov and have ached since, recently had severe back pain but put down to lifting my poorly dog so anything can and will send the fear into your head. Stay calm and strong and let us know the outcome  Xx
Posts.Title: Mets

Posts.Content: Walking into theatre seems common now. on 1010 I had gastric bypass and walked in and when had first breast surgery did too. I think it is all to do with keeping the risk of cross infection down but don't know, may just be cheaper as don't have to pay a porter!!!
Posts.Title: Anyone had bilateral masectomy with immediate LD flap reconstruction...

Posts.Content: having got through breast cancer and all the treatment, I was just coming to terms with life. Today I took my 12 year old Labrador to the vet as he seemed unwell. Turns out he probably has liver cancer. We are getting ready to say goodbye. I went through my year of hell and now can't stop crying for my fury friend. Sorry I just needed to share with people who care Thanks xx
Posts.Title: What is it with cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi probably having double mx and have been looking at nipple tattoos too. i wondered about a pair of Herts or lips, my hubbie reacons we should try out options using haribo .!!!! also friend suggested silver ball implant and tattoo to save nipple reconstruction, anyone done this to get the sticky out bits?
Posts.Title: Re. nipple tattoos, can you help?

Posts.Content: Hi, Do get your B12 checked. Since having B12 issues I can't eat eggs as they taste metallic. It is the white that does it. Maybe just try the yolk? Once I have had B12 injection it is easier but not perfect. This problem got much worse during and since chemo. Good luck
Posts.Title: Can't eat eggs after chemo.

Posts.Content: Hi Bev Yep I did for the 3 FEC. Felt bloated and uncomfortable, wind without the farting!! Settled once on T which brought its own issues Good luck x
Posts.Title: Weight gain on chemo

Posts.Content: Like others say chemo is tough but do able You don't know what resilience you have until put to the test. What choice do we have? We just have to get on with it. It is great you have 2 fab sisters who I am sure will be there for you. Use their love to keep you strong, don't beat yourself up when you wobble and be kind to yourself, rest when you need, have fun when you can and hide if that is required but don't forget to peep out from the duvet occasionally. Good luck, much love, strength and positive vibes beaming to you X
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: Hi I had gastric bypass in 2010 . Have completed FEC and had issues with vomiting, in theory should not be able to vomit but can. Felt very nausious and was sick regularly. Also from constipation to diarrhoea in one sitting!! am on T now and this makes me mega bloated, diarrhoea and uncomfortable so didnt eat 2 out of 3 weeks. talk to your oncologist for advice or ask to see a dietician, they may have some ideas to help. Don't go it alone, reach out and find what you need. good luck xxx
Posts.Title: J pouch and fec chemo coping

Posts.Content: Hi all, Thought I would post update. Double mx and DIEP flap Jan 2016 , all went wrong and left with huge a do scar and tissue in new boobs breaking down. I am now back on the boat, sailed from Sicily to Greece and now exploring the Peloponese !!!  One draw back, tummy wound Still NOT healed!!! Any advice on how to get it healed gratefully received. Am swimming in sea, keeping it as dry as possible in 40 degrees heat and 68% humidity!!! Hope all coping. Stay positive and nail this damned disease Much love xxx
Posts.Title: Hi all update JJsailor

Posts.Content: Hi there I too have struggled with weight all my life and unfortunately put on with chemo. However this was poor choice. Like others have said food tastes different and so you tend to eat what tastes OK. I went to the yoyo diet type of eating. Chemo week hardly anything, week 2 sweets and crackers, week 3 healthy food. Along with no energy meaning no exercise (any excuse) weight went on. It did stress me big time and I have to admit I went into bullaemia mode ( not a good idea).  However I resolved to sort it out. Having said that 7 weeks in hospital after a  double mastectomy with disastrous reconstruction meant I ended up losing 2 stone (result)! So, all I would say is don't beat yourself up about weight gain, you have enough to deal with getting through this damn journey. Good luck, stay calm and be kind to yourself. You WILL come out the other side a changed and beautiful new person. Much love xxx
Posts.Title: Weight gain on chemo

Posts.Content: what a birthday!! started getting canes tan prescribed for the thrush that has moved from mouth, through system and to nethers. Whilst I was there thought I'd ask to test wee, left a sample and went to stay with a friend some 30 miles away. late afternoon I have a frantic call from the GP nurse, did I have symptoms of UTI? Doh yes why would I have left a wee? Do I have temp, yes but up and down.... I need antibiotics NOW!!!!! dip test showed very bad infection. So this afternoon spent at walk in centre getting antibiotics, that will help the thrush just fine. so along with sore mouth from Tax, sore bits, bloated tummy, no alcohol and everything tasting of cardboard I have had a FAB birthday (not:( ) roll on next year and freedom from chemo, treatment and cancer plus point, at least I got away without being admitted .....for now!
Posts.Title: Narrow escape

Posts.Content: Hi I am younger and have found chemo so trying. As far as I can see the depression and tears are part of the shock and extreme tiredness. I seem to cry with exhaustion rather than feeling depressed. I too have tight aching feeling from back of chest and around my back which makes walking painful, simple painkillers help, make sure she asks for some and doesn't just soldier on. as for the feeling poorly 4 days after, yep me too, I find it continues for about 7 days and I feel semi normal 3 days prior to next chemo which does indeed put the dread into the next one. so all in all what mum feels is pretty normal. Although I don't get confused as such words fail me and I use the wrong words all the time, ie. The red sassauge - a tomatoe, suitcases - shoelaces and best of all going to the water seat- toilet, so I guess there is no hope for me. please reassure mum and get her to read this site for some sense of normality, if she doesn't use a computer either do it for her or ask what she wants to know, post and print answers for her. I have found this site support is sometimes the only thing that drags me out of bed. she is lucky to have a daughter that cares so much, well done, keep strong and don't dis pair it will end sometime and some sort of normality will prevail. much love to you and mum J
Posts.Title: my mum is struggling with chemo

Posts.Content: I finished chemo Nov2 but nails OK. however have 3 very prominent ridges in each nail, now about halfway up nail. Kept them short and painted. Are they going to fall off. Feel OK at the mo.
Posts.Title: Nails!!!!!

Posts.Content: Oh my love you are indeed so young! That said you will still be fit and have good stamina. dont fret. You can change nothing now so stay calm and just meet each issue head on with a positive and fighting attitude. you have time before Tues to have a fab night with friends or family. Have fun, a drink yummy food and go into surgery with the attitude of whatever!! Because whatever life throws at you you WILL COPE, there is only one way and that is forward. we are here and know what it is like to over think, don't search google until you know more then use Macmillan or breast cancer sites as they are realistic, appropriate for care in UK and reliable. I will keep everything crossed that you have clear nodes and just need the critter removed with a blast of radio for insurance. You will be sore after as it is more painful removing stuff from under arm than boob, just take what they give you and start using the arm ADAP. thinking of you, let us know how you get on. muck love J
Posts.Title: New to here

Posts.Content: hi all start T tomorrow having had my 3 FEC..  I have forund it hard being sick and nauseated, very tired and aching especially back and loin. i am worried T is gonna wipe me again, seems to get worse each time. so anyone had GRC and then T and how did it affect you?  Have Macmillan fundraising day with coffee then afternoon tea Fri, day 4 oops am I gonna be wiped? thanks J
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: Thanks guys, well day 2 and woke with stomach cramp with following runny tummy. Tongue  is tingling and weirdly my skin is so itchy I am scratching myself raw, hope not allergic reaction.  Feeling rough, up and down, nauseated but no vomiting this time, headache and wobbly. not looking forward to next few days as have Macmillan coffee morning and afternoon tea Fri and need to cook, oops
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: I was exhausted on T only so guess you are normal. I finished 3 weeks ago and still feel like bambi J
Posts.Title: tac chemo

Posts.Content: Hi all Whilst spending some time in a marina in Crete I arranged a coffee morning. Well after an initial,offer of a few cakes we had the day yesterday and were inundated with cakes, goodies and mulled wine along with tea and coffee. The end result we raised € 334 . Amazing for such a small international community. An overwhelming feeling of love and support by people touched in some way by cancer. Very humbling. So,McMillan, are going to receive the money to continue to support anyone involved in this horrible disease. I know I would have struggled without them.
Posts.Title: Amazing support

Posts.Content: after an exhausting lead up too and successful Macmillan coffee day, yes day event, I had a quick bite to eat then did a flower and produce arrangement for the church harvest. Wanted to post pictures but can't get it on anyone know how?
Posts.Title: What am I on?

Posts.Content: Good morning, crap sleep and very chemo belly!!! TIRED!!!!!
Posts.Title: What am I on?

Posts.Content: Could be nerve re growth as takes about this time to re channel pathway. Hope all goes well at DR xx
Posts.Title: Breast and arm pain

Posts.Content: Hi B 1. YES YES YES,  I didn't have one for first and had 6 stabs then had one, little uncomfortable a few days but soooo worth it. 2. I had FEC followed by T, the side effects are very different, do take anti sickness and I used sea bands as well, every little helps! And yes feels naughty when you say FEC but I soon referred to it as FECCY FEC!! 3. I take multivitamins daily and added calcium too, do ask as they sometimes say you shouldn't take natural stuff, oh yeah my Achilles heel in all this has been urine infection so added in Cranberry tablets too. Load up on plenty of pampering before hand as most therapists won't touch you with a barge pole during chemo.  Finally, I don't know if you are cold capping hair but invest in a silk pillow case, it helps with the itchy scalp and is nice and cool on sweaty nights. good luck J
Posts.Title: Start of journey part 2

Posts.Content: Hi welcome to the club no one really wants to belong too. it is one heck of a roller coaster and once on it is hard to get time to think. Go with the flow, ask as many questions as you need and turn here for advice, help, moaning and HUGE HUGS J xxxx
Posts.Title: Newly Daiagnosed

Posts.Content: Congratulations, stay strong and well xxxx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: Hi it is a bit of a long way round but I click on discussions, find one about September chemo club, click then click join just below the heading. whre are you going for chemo, I have chemo 4 in Lister Stevenage tomorrow!! good luck
Posts.Title: re: How do I join September Chemo Group?

Posts.Content: I am due to have one as well soon as took 5 goes to give first dose and only have one available arm due to surgery. I think I will be Prius most of the time and maybe use a pretty head buff to cover when needed
Posts.Title: picc line's any tips on management,

Posts.Content: Oh my love this is perfectly understandable. Waiting is the worst part. Once you have an idea of what your treatment will be the roller coaster starts and you just get on with it. however I too have times when feel low and rotten.  Hang on in there and talk to your family, friends or us on this site and you will get trough it. good luck J xxxx
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Hi Have you tried the pineapple route. Eat either fresh or tinned pineapple. I liked tinned frozen as it relieved the soreness. I too had thrush a lot and when it went from my mouth it reared itself down below!!! Hope you get it sorted Much love X
Posts.Title: 2 months after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi all yep me too, after 3rd FEC it has been a horrendous 10 days!! Days so black I wanted to die, pain,vomiting, devoid of energy. I too have woken today and thanked whoever is there for the reprieve. so my fellow chemos, so glad many of you turning the corner and hang on in there if the corner is just out of reach. thanks for the support, don't know how I would cope sometimes but so nice to know this is 'normal'
Posts.Title: coming out of that dark tunnel.

Posts.Content: Hi all, Just a quick update.... I am nearly at the finish line (well for now).  Chemo complete...check Mastectomy and recon complete... Check Recon complications resolved.... Almost Flight booked to sail away on our boat.... Check!!! I leave 1 week today. OMG am so excited but strangely very tearful, yes I am getting help, having some hypnotherapy to see me through the middle of the past year. So my friends old and new.... It is possible to survive, one day and one tiny step at a time. Keep going, stay positive, remember cup half full not half empty and keep talking weather to friends and family or to friends and virtual family here. My heart and prayers will remain with all who are fighting this bloody horrible disease and those who are supporting them too. Much love to all You can catch up on our adventures by checking out our blog site at www.argonauta.co.uk  I will update it as soon as I get back on board. THANK YOU to all those who have kept me going in very dark times Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Nearly there

Posts.Content: Yep, a very normal reaction! weirdly the feeling doesn't go and you kind of just get on with it. i have had grade 3 ductal removed and am left with lots of what they called pre cancerous cells so will be having both breasts removed after I finish chemo. I was hormone negative so chemo the only option. hang on in there. It is usual for them not to have answers until surgery etc but it all kind of falls into place over the coming weeks. good luck with surgery, hey you get to have a nice pert boobie and rid of this horrible disease as well. love and positive vibes J. Xx
Posts.Title: It's confirmed.....cancer

Posts.Content: Go girl, kick the big C butt and strut your stuff. Use the energy to do everything you can to make whatever else comes up as easy as possible. much love J
Posts.Title: It's confirmed.....cancer

Posts.Content: Have you asked citizens advice re law. I am pretty sure they are able to put you on SSP but if it was a formal meeting that may lead to dismissal due to ill health they should have given you written notice and a chance to bring someone with you. Also should have produced formal minutes of the meeting. If it comes to it I would think you have a case for unfair dismissal or if you feel you have to resign then constructive dismissal. Do go to CAB and get advice. Try not to worry as it will affect your wellbeing and you need all the strength you have to keep on track. Good luck and much love xx
Posts.Title: Worried sick

Posts.Content: Wow looks good and thick and suits you. going tomorrow for the chop pre chemo:(
Posts.Title: Took the plunge and went to hairdressers today ...

Posts.Content: Ho  have they tested for parvo virus. I had that out of the blue several years back, couldn't even pick up a mug. worth an ask hope you get sorted, also try massage or hand wax baths, nay help  xx
Posts.Title: Joint pain update

Posts.Content: I am using Layton Denny nail food will wait and see
Posts.Title: NAIL TREATMENT.

Posts.Content: Hi I am glad you posted. I am going through chemo for triple negative grade 3 cancer and will have both breasts removed for DCIS ( pre cancerous cells) as a woman going through it I have appreciated when those who love me offer the chance to discuss. It is scary and your mum like me will want to protect their child, however I am strengthened by the openness and honesty of my son. try to talk to her, hold emotions if you can but of course it is OK to be upset. Give her time and the offer of someone to listen and do post here if you have questions etc. sending love J
Posts.Title: Newbie - feeling useless

Posts.Content: Hi I agree do as you feel comfortable. I found I was more comfortable with nothing on my head. If you present confident then the person interviewing probably won't even notice. Concentrate on selling your positive points, believe the job is yours. Good luck. Xxx
Posts.Title: Job interview

Posts.Content: Again on steroids, this time pre Tax. AWAKE and buzzing but sooooo tired. humph!!!
Posts.Title: Blasted steroids

Posts.Content: BRILLIANT:)
Posts.Title: Positive News

Posts.Content: Positive thoughts with you, sending hugs
Posts.Title: I'm back n worried

Posts.Content: Had first FEC yesterday, feel ok but headache, nausiated controlled by meds but feel like eyeballs gonna pop out and head explode!! telmp normal am I a wuss?
Posts.Title: Is headache after FEC normal?

Posts.Content: Ok thanks, just had few hours sleep, woken to same head and aching limbs, ooooh goodie lucky me :)
Posts.Title: Is headache after FEC normal?

Posts.Content: Welcome home and well done. Now you can heal and move forward, you are so brave and an inspiration to those of us yet to do the deed!, well done, gentle hugs and much love
Posts.Title: Home- post mastectomy

Posts.Content: Don't worry you will feel a bit more normal in next couple of days. First time round is all a bit new, second onwards you get to know your normal. hang on in there xxxx J
Posts.Title: Chemo symptoms

Posts.Content: Hi Apart from all you have had to deal with don't forget day 4-6 post op you of then get post anaesthetic blues, so not only normal due to diagnosis but normal post op. You have started a journey none of us wanted to be on but you will get through it. Be kind to yourself, ask your family for space but remember they are in pain too and like everyone else says, take each day as it comes. Some good, some bad, some just go. I am 1 year post chemo and 10 months post bilateral mastectomy. Life does go on, you do get used to your changed body even if you don't like it and I am sure your resolve will return. cancer is NOT going to beat US!!! Take care, smile at something every day and friend me if you need to. Much love
Posts.Title: Depressed

Posts.Content: Oh Andrea, life just keeps giving sometimes. All I can say is my prayers and positive thoughts are coming your way with a huge hug. Hang on in there. That light at the end is not the train about to hit it is a ray of hope. Much love Xxx
Posts.Title: Having a terrible week

Posts.Content: Fantastic news, well done you. Now celebrate like you have never done before :)
Posts.Title: finished

Posts.Content: Possibly an internal stitch or a tiny bit of scar tissue. if it doesn't improve see your GP for a check good luck J
Posts.Title: DIEP Reconstruction - Springy lumps along scar line

Posts.Content: Hi. OK DCIS is still in situ and has not broken out of the ducts. For those of us that have chemo and lumpectomy it is usually use to the lump being active and broken out of the duct. chemo is the only drug available to mop up cells if you have triple negative breast cancer, that is not any of the three hormones sensitive, oestrogen,herceptin  or progesterone. I can only assume the cancer DCIS was only in the breast tissue and no lymph nodes affected, they tend to test or clear them anyway, which is why you don't need extra treatment. I would say you have been very lucky to have caught it whilst still dormant and having mastectomy means the breast tissue has gone and the cancer with it. well done for getting this far and all the best with your healing. hope this helps J xx
Posts.Title: Very confused tonight!

Posts.Content: Hi Jen I had bilateral mastectomy as a precaution. Needed right removed as had grade 3 cancer removed then found multi focal DCIS fast growing in remaining tissue.mI opted for removal of both even though no sign in left one. Had recon at same time which has been complicated but probably due to being so low prior following chemo. If I had the same dilemma I would go for bilateral but get the recon later, especially if had already had chemo. I don't need radio so am now cancer free and on the mend slowly. Do what you think is right for you and don't over agonise when you make your decision. All the best Xxx
Posts.Title: bilateral mastectomy with one healthy breast??

Posts.Content: Oh sweetheart, just tell her the truth. She will be upset whatever you say but if you load it with the positive that the cancer has now gone as had surgery and everything else is mopping up then she is likely to be less panicky.  I wrapped all my stuff positively so my 87 year old dad didn't fret too much. You know parents are amazing and will act as if unfazed by things just to support you. Good luck and I think Skype is a good idea as means she can see you are ok Much love  X
Posts.Title: Telling mum

Posts.Content: Oh dear, they really don't get it do they? unfortunately we don't look after our own very well. I would just go for the letter. Why push yourself to get to work when the job is stressful enough. It may be that you will be physically fit but mentally not up to it, either Gp or occ helath should be able to support you. I would ask for counselling referral from GP and explain how you feel, they are usually pretty sympathetic, choose one that you think will be on your side. good luck I have to finish chemo and then have bilateral mastectomy so will be on the treadmill a little longer. Unfortunately was self employed for 2 years with minimal pay so don't qualify for ANY money help, fresh air is it and it is mega expensive going to hospital appointments weekly etc. all the best J
Posts.Title: Work issues

Posts.Content: Oh dear, they really don't get it do they? unfortunately we don't look after our own very well. I would just go for the letter. Why push yourself to get to work when the job is stressful enough. It may be that you will be physically fit but mentally not up to it, either Gp or occ helath should be able to support you. I would ask for counselling referral from GP and explain how you feel, they are usually pretty sympathetic, choose one that you think will be on your side. good luck I have to finish chemo and then have bilateral mastectomy so will be on the treadmill a little longer. Unfortunately was self employed for 2 years with minimal pay so don't qualify for ANY money help, fresh air is it and it is mega expensive going to hospital appointments weekly etc. all the best J
Posts.Title: Work issues

Posts.Content: Congratulations. and YES I filed and buffed mine then put on nail hardener and topcoat and they look much better J xxx
Posts.Title: Good news for a change

Posts.Content: Fantastic news, well done to you and mum for getting this far, amazing hopeful feeling, great xxxx
Posts.Title: Good news! Mum got the all clear after surgery!

Posts.Content: BHS do one called genie it is ultra soft but very supportive.mwas the only one I could squeeze it all into. 3 for £9.99 without the current discounts  X
Posts.Title: BRA talk

Posts.Content: Hi I would suggest call or see GP and ask for dermatology appointment. It is usually a long wait but at least someone will see it and make a diagnosis good luck J
Posts.Title: Red rash after mastectomy- any advice?

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry you have had to join the forum but welcome. What a shock for you, it is not an easy thing to get your head around. have you seen an oncologist yet?  Just do the exercises, it is very sore under the arm when you have nodes removed, I have not yet had mastectomy but have both breast removal to look forward to!! am currently having chemo to wipe up any stray cells prior to further surgery. I am triple negative, however HER 2 positive means they will throw some hormones at you to reduce the risks of future return. be kind to yourself, make sure you ask for help from friends and family, with such little ones you have it very hard. all the best and much love  J
Posts.Title: Newbie....BC...

Posts.Content: Love, prayers and healing hugs go with you xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy tomorrow, 9-9-15

Posts.Content: Anyone else had previous gastric bypass and then FEC. T chemo. Bit worried as diarrhoea or vomiting increases risk of renal failure in post gastric bypass
Posts.Title: Gastric bypass and chemo side effects

Posts.Content: Oh my love, I so understand, as a nurse I too go down the road of what if it is hiding etc. However you have got to try to look on the positive side, the cancer may well have gone, if it hasn't is there really any point in worrying yourself into the ground? Why waste this next year cause if you are gonna die anyway then have a bloody good time going down. Take analgesia regularly to stay comfortable, use oromorph if you need to but be aware it can make you feel even lower in mental health. I do think the memory thing is due to the treatment and the stress.  I know it is a cliche but please do see your GP and get some support through councelling, some anti depressants, cause your serotonin is probably screwed up from chemo and disturbed sleep patterns etc. or even occ health may be willing to help you. The thing breast cancer has taught me, don't wait to have a life, make a life. If you really do think it is all over then go seek help and get some answers. sending you love and positive vibes J
Posts.Title: Feeling Morbid

Posts.Content: Is the stitch under the skin? We used to use magnesium sulphate paste to draw out any foreign bodies in wounds. I would see if you can buy this in the chemist, if not put a blob of salon on a plaster and leave it overnight, next morning have a soak in the bath and hopefully it will come to a head and you can squeeze it out. failing that, it will come to the surface eventually. hope this helps J
Posts.Title: Stitches not dissolving.

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, hang in in there, now you are bound to be terrified, however it is possible it is some sort of fluid collection or infection. I am sure your onc didn't mean to scare you, they just want to be sure what is there before blasting with radio and causing even more inflammation. You will be aware of it now as they have pointed it out. When are they going to investigate, don't let it wait hassle them and explain how frightened you are and get it all moving. like  I say, stay as calm as you can and trust that they will get you sorted quickly. feel free to friend me if you need to talk and please keep us updated much love J
Posts.Title: Scared again

Posts.Content: Hi Jojo, you soppy thing thinking you can't cry out for help, O only wish I found this forum earlier, was well on the way down the crazy treatment road when I did but being able to say help I am scared and having the reassurances found here would have helped. i would say try not to panic, take someone with you, everything becomes surreal irrespective of the outcome, know you WILL be OK no matter what as we all have an inner reserve to face whatever we need to. finally I pray it is a fab outcome and just lumpy boobs for you. Please let us know the results, GOOD LUCK love and positive vibes J xxx
Posts.Title: breast clinic tomorow im worried sick

Posts.Content: Gigi, well done for getting through the day, standing in the rain and raising money already like I said GO GIRL !!!!! xxx
Posts.Title: Work with head scarf on !

Posts.Content: Go Girl like they say wear it as a badge of honour, be proud and if you get sick of it take it off and be bald and proud, that's what I am, stuff them. If they stare offer a photo as it lasts longer. however I am sure you will get loads of support and perhaps you can suggest a Macmillan coffee morning Fri and raise cash for this fab charity too good luck and let us know how it goes much love J
Posts.Title: Work with head scarf on !

Posts.Content: I can't say if it is normal but don't panic, take some painkillers and call in and see breast nurse or GP tomorrow. Your immunity will still be down so worth getting it checked. you are not alone in the panic/ fear cycle. It leaves a huge what if question mark behind. well done on getting through chemo and radio, am on chemo and not coping well hang on in there, take painkillers and vino if required and rest. help is out ther, seek it out first thing tomorrow. much love J
Posts.Title: terrible pain in breast.

Posts.Content: It may be a little optimistic about growing new boobs, but still you never know. poor you hormone rushes and spots at the same time!!!! still look on the bright side you an pinch your teenagers spot lotions instead of the other way around :)
Posts.Title: Acne!

Posts.Content: Hi Emily well done you for being proactive and finding support. It is a lonely time and for those with the cancer it is surreal so heaven only knows how those supporting us feel. i am glad you have found help and comfort, keep posting and we will keep replying. all the best for mum and thank you for being such a great daughter  xxx
Posts.Title: One week on..........Thank you!

Posts.Content: Oh my love, gentle hugs and love coming your way xxx stay strong but do withdraw, lick wounds and take time to come to terms with what your body and mind has had to cope with much love J xxxx
Posts.Title: Tearful

Posts.Content: Love it dream thief
Posts.Title: Eyebrows

Posts.Content: I am having a bad day,mI think the definition of chemo should be..... If you don't have it you may die... If you do you may want to die!!!
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks guys for the encouragement. Jedikmight I too will finish nov and then double Mx so will be around for some time. Feel free to personal friend me and we can moan away in private. x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all well my first month was rubbish I had one FEC and then had severe headache followed by spiking temp and finally kidney infection. Spent 7 days in hosp on IV antibiotics ( they would not use PICC line at first until knackered remaining veins) then second chemo postponed until 10 August!!!!! so will be a month behind treatment and so ticking off the weeks is pointless. feeling angry and low. oh yeah and hair fell out day 13 so now baldie, mind you have been told by friends it suits me so although I got a wig today it is hot ant feels itchy so may just stay bald!  Oh and another thing there is no such thing as a wig on NHS. Although free the prescription costs £63.90!!!!  sorry moan over  J
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Be calm, strong and honest. With your parents be postitive but don't fear being vulnerable. with your children I agree tell them together and be ready for tears, anger and questions.  All in all be true to ourself, this is a lonely disease sapping energy which is made worse by trying to protect the ones you love. Prepare for a horrible time and accept the love they will give you. as for hair, try the cold cap or get wigs ready if you need chemo. good luck and positive vibes my dear xxxxx let us know how it goes
Posts.Title: Telling the parents tomorrow??

Posts.Content: I woke this morning and my eyebrows have all but disappeared. Had  second FEC 2 1/2 weeks ago, is this usual?
Posts.Title: Eyebrows

Posts.Content: Oooh have lost pubes as well now, there is a God!!!
Posts.Title: Eyebrows

Posts.Content: So sad to read this. Love and warm embrace.
Posts.Title: Getting really scary now.

Posts.Content: I had DieP after bilateral mastectomy but have a strange lump and also told one stopm clinic to allow imaging. I am also petrified but we have to be positive  Not too long to wait and if tey were really worried would have been sooner. Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Firm swelling of 'breast'

Posts.Content: Having had all clear 4 months ago I have been having treatment and investigation for spinal issues. I went today. And he mentioned I have a likely ' cyst' on one kidney. Sorry but am I the only person to freak out at this. He went ahead and booked spinal op end of October but I  am terrified, he did write to my GP to get it checked, should I contact breast nurse, I am actually going away for a week tomorrow after such a yuck time. Oh hell I am so scared
Posts.Title: Scared its spread

Posts.Content: Well I've done it !!! I booked my flight back to the boat in Sicily. I am not yet fully healed on tummy and left boob still breaking down the tissue but sod it I have had enough!!! Soo... I have until 15 th June to get well, fit and head in the right place. Excited that am beginning to take back control. Stay strong and be kind to yourself Xxx
Posts.Title: I've done it - booked flight

Posts.Content: Hi unfortunately the diagnosis do change. I was diagnosed with grad 1- 2 and after op was grade 3. Margins and nodes clear but multifocalDCIS high grade fast growing DCIS. This does not show up on mammograms and it was luck the have noticed it before it breaks out. however as was trip,e negative no hormones for me so having chemo. I have made the decision rather than go for further WLE I will go for mastectomy and the surgeon has agreed it sensible to remove both with reconstruction at the point of removal. This is based on our lifestyle, due to go live on our boat in the Med so apps for scans could be difficult. although my diagnosis didn't change much the treatment has, first said 6 chemo, then 5 , back to 6. Then was due op and radio but due to mastectomies no radio required. good luck with the op and your journey, do keep in touch or friend me if you want to chat privately. kind regards J
Posts.Title: Treatment and Diagnosis constantly changing

Posts.Content: Hi Sheryl, I am still early on the road but a diagnosis of cancer does send you reeling and takes so much energy physically and emotionally that it is hardly surprising that you are struggling to get back to normal. However maybe it is time to seek some help. There are some great support courses run through Macmillan which help adjust after it is all over. Obviously being back at work it may be difficult to get to but I think it will be worth while, stay in this state and you are likely to burn out and become ineffective. please do seek help, you can see your GP and ask for counselling or maybe even something through your work? good luck and be reassured you are not abnormal, just struggling to adjust to your new normal. all the best J
Posts.Title: Breast cancer recovery

Posts.Content: Hi Sheryl, I am still early on the road but a diagnosis of cancer does send you reeling and takes so much energy physically and emotionally that it is hardly surprising that you are struggling to get back to normal. However maybe it is time to seek some help. There are some great support courses run through Macmillan which help adjust after it is all over. Obviously being back at work it may be difficult to get to but I think it will be worth while, stay in this state and you are likely to burn out and become ineffective. please do seek help, you can see your GP and ask for counselling or maybe even something through your work? good luck and be reassured you are not abnormal, just struggling to adjust to your new normal. all the best J
Posts.Title: Breast cancer recovery

Posts.Content: Happy birthday indeed, a birthday shared with me!!! Have a fab day  J xxxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY !!!!!

Posts.Content: Happy birthday indeed, a birthday shared with me!!! Have a fab day  J xxxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY !!!!!

Posts.Content: I will be 1 year post FEC T and not on any meds as was triple negative. However I am getting lots of days where I am so exhausted and my joints hurt so much it is an effort to get moving. Is this normal.  I did have a disastrous DIPE in Jan 2016 and was in hospital 52 days but thought I should feel better by now. Anyone been like this please?
Posts.Title: 1 yr post chemo is this normal?

Posts.Content: Don't want to be a bad omen but maybe FEC will affect you differently. I have had 3x FEC and cut to start 3X T on Monday. It was OK ish at first but last round wiped me. i too gonna have surgery and think that your body will need to recuperate before having to cope with the shock of operation. i have had to put my life on hold, I had given up job, bought a boat, rented house out then found have BC, grade 3 invasive and high grade DCIS triple negative. The last 5 months has been a whirlwind of surgery and chemo and living with a friend. i can't wait to get to the life we planned but need to get through this first. be kind to yourself, don't rush it, when else are you gonna have the support of colleagues other than now and your job is hard enough without having to be fighting this damn critter!! good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Can I speed up treatment

Posts.Content: NOOOOOOOO!!!! Oh Clare what a bummer. I can appreciate the anxiety and let down, I have been given 4 dates, due to be done next Thursday God willing. Contact them and play merry hell, put the emotional blackmail to full use and complain to authority. Darling hang on in there, it will happen and you will be fab. Much love
Posts.Title: Diep Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Judy Never worry about moaning on here, this is the safe place we need. You DO need to think of you. Yes you will be concerned for mum but she will have others to care too and you need the strength to get through chemo week by week. I amsure mum has been as she is because she feels guilty that you have to go through this. You know we all hit out at those we love, and she may also be so scared re her future, possibly leaving you and not seeing you get better. However, maybe she is just a selfish lady, some are and they will have to get on with it. Whatever she is she is your mum. Be kind to her and you. Do what YOU need and fit her in on the better days. Fingers crossed for her and obviously a huge gentle hug for you Much love xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling helpless and guilty

Posts.Content: Hi Claire, wow what a wait and what a fantastic achievement to loose so much weight well done. I don't have much to say other than am also due DIEP immediately after bilateral mastectomy, just waiting a date, so feel free to friend me and we can do this together much love J
Posts.Title: Diep Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Claire, wow what a wait and what a fantastic achievement to loose so much weight well done. I don't have much to say other than am also due DIEP immediately after bilateral mastectomy, just waiting a date, so feel free to friend me and we can do this together much love J
Posts.Title: Diep Reconstruction

Posts.Content: NOOOOOOOO!!!! Oh Clare what a bummer. I can appreciate the anxiety and let down, I have been given 4 dates, due to be done next Thursday God willing. Contact them and play merry hell, put the emotional blackmail to full use and complain to authority. Darling hang on in there, it will happen and you will be fab. Much love
Posts.Title: Diep Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Mmmm chocolate, M&M' saw me through pregnancy but found M&S dark chocolate ginger biscuits yesterday... 2 birds with one stone
Posts.Title: Diet & Chocolate for nutritional purposes ;-D

Posts.Content: In my own experience this is just how it was for me.  Pall I got was the keep positive, look to the future, don't panic about what may not happen and also you are over reacting!!! how the hell can anyone who is not facing this horrific journey decide how I should react. I was laid back about the hair loss until it started to happen then freaked wanting my hubby to shave my head straight away, he was ... Oh it's only a little bit thinning, if you shave it then you look like you have cancer!! Doh I have!!!  I think their reaction is indeed the denial you say. Give them time to get their head around it and find someone who will listen, sympathise and kick butt when needed. If necessary just on this forum there are plenty of us that can help. hang on in there, keep the wild horses of anxiety in check and do keep holding the positive that you WILL get through this, after all we have no choice other than to get through whatever way we can. good luck and a warm hug J
Posts.Title: Family in denial

Posts.Content: Yep the tingling, numbness and pain under arm is def worse than lump removal. being in a bubble looking in is just how I feel. Due to start chemo in next week or so then double mastectomy when that finished. just take each day at a time. hang on in here, it is a long journey but keep your eye o. The light at the end xxx
Posts.Title: breast dancer er positive

Posts.Content: Hi stupid doctor!!! the oncology dr is the one to believe and discuss EVERYTHING with. had lump out, nodes clear but grade 3 invasive with lots of pre cancerous cells. gonna go for double mastectomy. am triple negative meaning no hormones to throw at it so started FEC T chemo today. 3 FEC 3 T 21 days apart. if only have more tissue excised have to have radiotherapy and like you big plans for future, going off sailing and don't need the thought of reoccurrence in rather boob to stop that. your journey is beginning. You can do whatever you choose and even if on treatment can go onto your course, lots of people have chemo Fri so OK by Mon. Good luck, stay calm cry if you want and keep writing xx
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone. Have contacted oncology nurse today to ask to discuss straight to Mastectomy as really worried it will not all go and will end up 3 ops and still mastectomy. i was fortunate that I took the step to go to a Macmillan centre and talk with Macmillan nurse pre results, she was good enough to go through all possible outcomes which helped to keep me calm and able to think straight when I was told the bad news. pre all this I had organised a Macmillan support coffee morning and was due another one, never knew I would need support and will do my best to run another one. Kept myself busy making cards so will sell them as well. there MUST be something positive out of this bloody disease!
Posts.Title: Gutted bad news

Posts.Content: Went for follow up after lumpectomy and sentinel node removal today and tols was a stage 3 not 2 ductal and the margins not clear, lots of pre cancerous cells and another op for 6 more cm removal with possibility of mastectomy if can't get it all. also triple negative so chemo and radio to be done as well. Also CT to check everything else pre chemo especially as broke back  sat year. feel numb. not helped by now got chest infection!!!
Posts.Title: Gutted bad news

Posts.Content: Quite normal to have post op blues even without the tension, fear and emotions that breast cancer brings.mlove yoursel for a while and take the time you need to heal both ohysically and emotionally xx
Posts.Title: Quadrantectomy plus LD Flap

Posts.Content: Hi all I just wanted to share having had last T chemo on 2 Nov and been through the usual hell of side effects I am coming out the other side. However the good thing I want to share... for the past 3 weeks my hair on my head has been growing and I now have about 3 mm of fine baby hair, very dark in colour and so soft it feels like a peach!!! I am due at a wedding tomorrow, my hair does look a little weird but I don't care, at least I now have some, a little more would have been great as could wear a facinator but will have to wear the faithful hat instead :) hope others have some positives to share soon and if not, the positives will come back. Hang on in there much love J
Posts.Title: Something good for a change

Posts.Content: Hi Yep all quite normal, also if have already had op then you will already be a bit low. Go forward with inner strength and resolve. You CAN do this, one step at a time and with the help and love of us all Good luck and hang on in there xx
Posts.Title: Having a wobble

Posts.Content: I call it chemo belly. Noisy tummy, cramps sweating then a pooh. I can go from constipated to diarrhoea in one sitting. Along with the really smelly farts it is now a normal occurrence during the chemo first 2 weeks. dont take laxative unless you can't go, just drink loads of water to help keep hydrated. It will sort itself out ready for the next round, good luck J By the way, join the October or soon to be November chemo club, lots more help re chemo stuff there J
Posts.Title: Strange SE

Posts.Content: You know all hose supporting us talk about being brave but it is just a way of dealing with the shock and horror of it happening to us. Once over the initial shock as treatment starts you will be so focussed on getting through it will take over and appears to be bra pert. You will,be amazed at te reserves of strength and bloody mindedness you will find you have. Stay stron, be kind to yourself and moan away here, that's what we are here for to support and empathise. Much love xxx
Posts.Title: How are you all so brave, I've just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: I have been on strong antibiotics since Weds for UTI. I have gone away for a few days with a friend. I am now 11 days post Tax. through out today my temp has hovered at 37.8- 38.5 degrees. i don't have unusual pain, just usual joints and a bit of back ache. i don't want to call hops as am afraid they will make me go in and that puts end to weekend away, however am a bit worried that even on antibiotics I am spiking fevers. any sensible advice please?
Posts.Title: Unwell and unsure

Posts.Content: Quick update. Temp stayed above 38 and I felt crappy so cut short break and went to hospital. Bloods low but ok, so have 1 x dose very strong antibiotics and 1 litre saline and back home. Do feel much better but still pretty unwell. also new antibiotics All I have to do now is face the husbands Wrath for going in first place, bloody chemo, you can never win:(
Posts.Title: Unwell and unsure

Posts.Content: Hi all, So go back to see plastic surgeon Friday, am now coming up to six weeks post chemo!!! When I last saw him he would not consider surgery as I had needed to inject blood thinners into tummy because of a clot in PICC line and had 2 small pea sized lumps in tummy fat. he said if operates with them there the diner tissue will die. So I have been popping arnica tablets and rubbing arnica into the areas, one has gone, one is smaller but still there, you can also still see the skin discolouration from the bruising that was there. not sure what he is going to say but really hope to gat a date for the op, know it will be at least mid Jan but need to know when to settle my mind. So, wish me luck and keep fingers crossed for a date. Love to all and hang in you will eventually complete your journey. Much love  J xxxx
Posts.Title: See plastics Friday

Posts.Content: I am 6 months post chemo and also hated the grey, went for highlights and they used peroxide and I went yellow blond so bought a nice and easy permanent light brown and love it. You know if it gets to you that much what have you got to loose, it's only hair and will grow again as it has this time. Go girl!!!!!
Posts.Title: Colouring Hair

Posts.Content: Judith my heart goes out to you. May you be held in the love of all here and those you are close too. So sorry for your loss. Sleep well and stay kind to yourself. Sending much love and a reassuring hug xxx
Posts.Title: Falling apart now it's over

Posts.Content: Wow love the three good things, thanks My 3 good things today Visited dad and had lunch Sorted out meeting with Macmillan nurse Booked flights to Amsterdam next week to visit friends!!!!
Posts.Title: Falling apart now it's over

Posts.Content: Oh sweetie so sorry to hear the cap hasn't stopped the moult. I braved it and apart from the initial shock feel quite liberated by a bald head.  I know people look but at least they can guess why I look so crap. anyway, stay calm, be positive, don't stress as I am sure it can make it worse and yes the tenderness does lessen.  Hang on in there girl, you are in great company!!!! xxxxx
Posts.Title: Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Thanks all. Now home with decent bed and proper food feel better already. Can't get over how weak my legs are, even worse than during the bad chemo days, guess 7 weeks in bed have taken their toll on my muscles, stairs are not to be sniffed at! Hope all doing OK. Xx
Posts.Title: Back from hospital after DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi I too am exhausted post FEC no2 due for FEC no3 Weds and am worried I won't ever get out of bed. I thought maybe my HB is low but sounds par for the course. Good luck, and just sleep when you need too. I have been asleep more than awake today. :)
Posts.Title: energy levels ?

Posts.Content: Thanks so much everyone, such a relief to know this is OK. what I didn't say is I broke my wrist Jan and it healed wrongly and needs re setting and breaking. This followed a spine fracture last year as well so guess I am hard on myself.  I thank everyone so much for support and send positive vibes to all going through the quagmire of cancer ! JJ xxx
Posts.Title: Is it normal to feel so low, tired and achy?

Posts.Content: I had lump removed and sentenial nodes removed 2 weeks ago. I bounced back in first week but now feel dreadful. Tired, aching a lot and soooo tearful. Am I just making a big thing of nothing?  Have to wait until 4 June for results and feel like I. Am panicking for nothing but can't make myself get out from under duvet today. am I. Just being over dramatic?
Posts.Title: Is it normal to feel so low, tired and achy?

Posts.Content: Hi, Well 7 weeks later and I have finally left hospital!!! I had bilateral mastectomy and DIEP flap reconstruction. I knew things could go wrong but never expected what happened. The flaps took with a few hiccups and some extra surgery to graft an area that died after excessive swelling. This is still healing. However it was the tummy that has been the issue. I got infection in the wound, a resistant superbug ( Not MRSA) the result it ate away my flesh and I have ended with what can only be described as a crater in my abdomen. They have put a graft on but this just covers the muscle, there is no fat over it and I have a 'ledge' about 4 cm deep where the rest of my abdomen finishes. I don't want to scaremonger but PLEASE think about ALL the possible risks. I have been unlucky but would never had this done and would have just had mastectomy if O knew what was going to happen. I got home yesterday, am so weak could barely make the stairs and have a long way to go. Hope all are hanging on in there. It is not the cancer that you have to fight it is the results of the treatment that kills the bugger!!! Good lock and love to all
Posts.Title: Back from hospital after DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi all Has anyone else gone through treatment strong and determined then after all clear felt so tired, tearful and lost they don't want to get out of bed. Is this normal or am I sliding down the slippery road to depression. I have been depressed before and am still on medication but the fear and tears are getting worse. Any help will be gratefully received. Thanks xxx
Posts.Title: Falling apart now it's over

Posts.Content: Thanks guys, You know I have decided to talk tomMacmillan Nurse and have appointment Friday. Then I am visiting friends in Amsterdam for 4 days, just because I can and hope to feel a little more normal. Stay strong and cry when you need Much love xxxx
Posts.Title: Falling apart now it's over

Posts.Content: Hi, thanks. yeah told grade 2 ductal invasive oestrogen negative but that is it. said looked like hadn't spread but had nodes removed anyway. cant stop crying today. Feeling so low. had other stuff going on, up to the day before op was nursing sister in law dying of brain primaries, she died morning after my op so just been to funeral. She leaves 2 young kids and I feel so sad but guilty I couldn't do more. am a complete mess!!!
Posts.Title: Is it normal to feel so low, tired and achy?

Posts.Content: Hi my love all VERY normal feelings, it is like getting on a roller coaster and being unable to get off. I too was convinced it had spread and I was gonna die but it hasn't and I am NOt gonna let this bloody disease get me. hang on in there, get as much help,as you can and TALK, here or call the Macmillan helpline, they are amazing and such a comfort. the worse part of this is it can't be seen so your mind runs riot, what if this, that and the other. you my love are lucky, you have been caught early and like Driemthief says 90% of us beat it, You and me we are in that, positive thinking promotes the inner being to succeed. stay strong, keep posting even if you feel daft and I send you a huge hug and a bag full of positive vibes to be used little and often. take care and hang on love J
Posts.Title: Diagnosed yesterday...

Posts.Content: Oh Heather, you are not making a fuss!!!  You must feel so low after such extensive surgery and it is all a shock to the system without that niggle of results. be kind to yourself, if your friend has the hump that is her problem not yours and your guy friend, I am sure he just wants to make it better and can't. just take the time you need, it is painful surgery and very early days yet. stay focussed on you and it will all go by and you will be able to move forward from this stressful and painful time. sending gentle hugs and positive vibes J xxxx
Posts.Title: Quadrantectomy and LD flap

Posts.Content: Hi steroids are given to reduce the risks of severe allergic reaction that can cause death!!! I know when you take them you buzz, shake and don't sleep but surely if you are going to go through the hell of chemo you want to take the best care of yourself and body that you can. Steroids for short term use are safe and can be vital in ensuring safe take up of the chemo drugs given. i have to say after this round of Tax and the steroids before and after not taking them would be better but, hey, just gotta do whatever it takes to kill this nasty little critter!!! please think carefully before making such decisions, especially if you haven't spoken with the one first, if you don't have all the info your division can't be informed and may be dangerous. sorry nag over. Sending a big hug to compensate the nagging and of course loads of positive healing and sleepy vibes xxxxx
Posts.Title: Re: Steroids

Posts.Content: I guess that anything to raise awareness of this horrible disease can be good. I too feel sad when I see things like this but you know if it jerks someone's mind to check or go to their mamogram, makes them conscience to give for research or support then that is positive. maybe, we as people with cancer, need to just not look if it hurts too much. The woman in the clip must have been willing to share so she must have thought it may help someone.   dont waste energy getting mad at such things, get mad at the illness and use the energy to fight!!!  Stay positive my lovely xxx
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: After what feels like forever ( finished chemo on 3 Nov) finally get to have mx and recon on Thurs. Now it is near am really feeling very anxious. Scared of anaesthetic and pain and what I will look like. So all out there fingers crossed all goes well. BBB here I come (bye bye boobs)!!!!
Posts.Title: Bilateral mastectomy and recon on Thursday sacred!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Alice orry to hear your results. I understand the just get on with it thing, everyone's says I am amazing and brave but just gotta beat this. keep strong, look on the glass as half full and you will win. good luck J
Posts.Title: Grade 1

Posts.Content: Certainly after lymph node removal, it is the nerves being irritated. However if hot red etc see Gp J
Posts.Title: burning

Posts.Content: You just don't get the F which is the  Fluroucil component /
Posts.Title: Post Breast Cancer operation Chemo type

Posts.Content: Well done so far, you brave amazing lady much love xxxx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy, a week on

Posts.Content: Still probably nerve damage. why did they do mastectomy and no node removal, sure they were clear? i had duct all cancer removed but found widespread DCIS so going back for bilateral mastectomy after chemo finished
Posts.Title: burning
